about_the_game:
A digital world awaits! Construct your own virtual world simulation with the Cruising the Circuits tileset for RPG Maker.

Note: This set makes use of a LOT of transparency; please buy only if you’re comfortable working with transparent layered tiles and parallaxes!

This Digital World Tileset Includes:

Ground tiles:

Digital “waterfall” with binary text flow effect (green and purple)
Green, blue, purple, pink and gray plain glass floors
Solid floors in white, green, blue, gray, pink and purple
Heavy metal edge with black center
Green/purple transparent grids
Several “circuit” and “chip” patterns
Glitchy floors
and more!

See screenshots for a sample of some ground tiles and possible combinations. Only the blue-green variation is shown, but all are available in pink/purple as well.

Walls/roofs:

Walls to match floors.

Also includes (in blue/green and pink/purple/orange versions):

Stairs to match floors. (Including diagonal stairs.)
Decorative “tech” elements – bright shapes and arrows, octagons, lit circles, binary pattern.
Plant-like shapes
“Doors” and “windows”
Seating and tables
Beds (two sizes)
Capsule shapes that can hold a normal RPG Maker sprite
Signs (with extra text and blank signs so you can make your own)
Glowing pipes
Glowing octagonal pads
A variety of glass-front crates with glowing objects inside
Glowing pillars
Small, random tech objects
Large ring, with and without brackets, large enough for a road to pass through. (See screenshots.)
Brackets as separate objects so you can use them as random decor.

Events and Animations:

Arrows
Floating diamonds
Floating diamonds with pedestal (can open like a treasure box)
Glowing orbs
Floating screens
Crosshairs
Question mark and exclamation mark
“Flowing data” animation
3 large and 3 small glitch animations…use for enemies or “bugs” in the system!


Parallaxes

Includes 6 parallaxes: a circuit board pattern (with small variation), cloudy “corrupted data” pattern with ASCII, binary and number variations, CRT close-up, random squares, glitchy green pattern, and a bold purple and pink glitchy vertical pattern, useful for when things go wrong.
